snippet: Shares in Plug Power, based in Latham, N.Y., rose 4.5 percent after the closing bell as the deal also helps the fuel-cell maker expand into the stationary backup fuel cell market.
abstract: Plug Power says it bought fuel-cell stack maker ReliOn for about $4 million in an all-stock deal, as the company looks to diversity its supplier base.
lead_paragraph: Shares in Plug Power, based in Latham, N.Y., rose 4.5 percent after the closing bell as the deal also helps the fuel-cell maker expand into the stationary backup fuel cell market.

headline.main: Plug Power Buys ReliOn to Diversify Its Suppliers
